headline: 'That's Something We Didn't Quite Anticipate': The Moto X, And Why Former Motorola CEO Says Building Smartphones In The US Is Nearly Impossible
summary: In 2013, telecommunications company Motorola Solutions Inc. (NYSE:MSI) attempted to set itself apart from the smartphone pack by doing something relatively unheard of: manufacturing its devices in the US. "There was a segment of customers that said, ‘Hey, if you produce products in the United States, I'm more likely to consider them," former Motorola CEO Dennis Woodside told CNN. The experiment didn't last long. A year later, the company had shut down its Texas factory and gone back to building
